notes: Entry-level Buick Standard Six series (1925-1929). Inline-6 engine. Multiple body styles including open touring cars. RWD. Mechanical brakes, 6-volt electrical, magneto ignition. Difficulty modifier 1.3 reflects mid-1920s brass-era proximity, hand-fitted components, mechanical brakes only, and extreme parts scarcity. Data sourced from Wikipedia Buick Standard Six article, December 19, 2024 revision.

Mid-range Buick Master Six series (1925-1928). Larger inline-6 than Standard Six. Multiple body styles including touring and roadster. RWD. Mechanical brakes, brass-era construction techniques. Difficulty modifier 1.3 reflects mid-1920s brass-era proximity, hand-fitted construction, obsolete systems, and extreme parts scarcity. Data sourced from Wikipedia Buick Master Six article, December 19, 2024 revision.

Series 50 and Series 60 models (1926-1929). Inline-6 engines. Multiple body styles. RWD. Body-on-frame construction with wood framing. Mechanical brakes, 6-volt electrical. Difficulty modifier 1.3 reflects late-1920s brass-era proximity, wooden body framing, hand-assembled construction, and extreme parts scarcity. Data sourced from Wikipedia Buick history articles, December 19, 2024 revision.
